{"step_by_step_thinking": "The relevant documents suggest that nitroglycerin is used to relieve angina. The Evaluation of the effectivity of Nitromint spray in comparison with sublingual tablet in emergency and ambulance practice document states that both the sublingual tablet and aerosol forms relieved or controlled the complaints and symptoms, and proved to be effective in a great number of cases. The A large scale comparative study in general practice with nitroglycerin spray and tablet formulations in elderly patients with angina pectoris document also suggests that the Nitrolingual spray is an acceptable alternative to tablets for relieving angina., "answer_choice": "B"}
